author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: President Trump has expressed frustration with the Supreme Court after it blocked his administration's efforts to deport migrants with alleged ties to Venezuelan gangs, and has accused the court of being "played" by the Radical Left.
title: Trump shows signs of mounting frustration with Supreme Court

author: Seth Cropsey and Harry Halem, opinion contributors
description: President Trump's Golden Dome initiative aims to create a comprehensive integrated air and missile defense system for the United States, leveraging proven technologies and partnering with traditional defense actors in the industry to mitigate the odds of a successful nuclear or conventional attack on the U.S. homeland.
title: Delivering missile defense requires leveraging American industry

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Scott Jennings, a CNN contributor and GOP political pundit, has been speculated as a potential Republican candidate to replace former Majority Leader Mitch McConnell in Kentucky, although he has not officially announced a bid.
title: CNN’s Scott Jennings responds to reports about possible Kentucky Senate run

author: Keri Rodrigues, opinion contributor
description: Public education needs to be transformed to better serve children, and while Democrats often talk about equity and accountability, they need to stop playing political games and start listening to families and fighting for the kind of public education that is excellent, equitable and accountable.
title: Stop loving public education like a five-year-old loves their mommy

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem confirmed that the Secret Service interviewed former FBI director James Comey after he posted a social media post that some interpreted as a threat against President Trump.
title: Secret Service interviewed Comey over '8647' post

author: Douglas MacKinnon, opinion contributor
description: Hating on Trump and creating as much self-serving publicity as possible are neither policies nor strategies.
title: Democrats are letting the far-left take them out of the running for 2028

author: Julia Manchester
description: Republicans are increasingly concerned that a bitter Senate primary in Texas next year could make it harder to defend their majority in the upper chamber. Earlier this week, the Senate Leadership Fund rolled out a poll showing Sen. John Cornyn (R-Texas) trailing Attorney General Ken Paxton by 16 points. But in a hypothetical general election...
title: Ugly Texas primary threatens GOP efforts to defend Senate

author: Addy Bink
description: Many of the features you see in the national parks today look the same as when your ancestors visited, even if the way we visit these lands has changed.
title: Photos: What visiting the national parks used to look like

author: Sophia Vento
description: President Trump on Saturday lambasted Walmart over its decision to raise prices this week due to the high costs associated with the Trump administration's trade war.  “Walmart should STOP trying to blame Tariffs as the reason for raising prices throughout the chain,” the president wrote on Truth Social. "Walmart made BILLIONS OF DOLLARS last year, far...
title: Trump berates Walmart over price hikes: ‘Eat the tariffs'

author: Steff Danielle Thomas
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio told reporters Saturday that while the U.S. appreciates Pope Leo XIV's offer to host Russia-Ukraine peace talks, the Vatican is not likely to help broker a peace deal in Eastern Europe. When asked if he intended to discuss the over three-year-long war during his meeting with Italian officials, Rubio said...
title: Rubio signals Vatican not a broker in Russia-Ukraine peace deal after offer to host talks

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: The House Oversight and Accountability Committee has announced hearings to investigate a suspected cover-up surrounding former President Biden's cognitive functions and autopen usage in office, following the release of audio from a 2023 interview with special counsel Robert Hur.
title: House GOP to probe 'cover up' after leaked Hur audio signals Biden struggle

author: Brahma Chellaney, opinion contributor
description: Trump not only spared Pakistan the consequences of its actions but also damaged the foundation of U.S.-India strategic trust.
title: Trump just undermined America’s strategic partnership with India

author: John Mac Ghlionn, opinion contributor
description: You’re not a citizen. You’re a QR code waiting to be approved.
title: Don’t fall for Sam Altman’s biometric booby trap

author: Jeremy Tanner
description: As President Trump's EPA prepares to roll back some of the safeguards against so-called "forever chemicals," some Americans may be wondering what they can do to protect their drinking water.
title: The EPA is removing some 'forever chemical' limits – how can I protect my drinking water?

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: House Oversight Committee Chair James Comer suggested that former FBI director James Comey may have been attempting to incite a coup or insurrection with his now-deleted social media post, while DHS Secretary Kristi Noem confirmed that Comey agreed to a voluntary interview at the Secret Service's Washington Field Office.
title: Comer: Comey trying to stir up 'some type of coup' against Trump with social post

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: President Trump defended his decision to accept a luxury jet from Qatar to replace Air Force One, dismissing bipartisan criticism as a "radical left story" and stating that the federal government is the beneficiary of the gift.
title: Trump defends Qatar jet gift, hits Baier for pushing 'radical left story'

author: Richard Vedder, Opinion Contributor
description: American universities are facing a decline in public support due to unclear ownership structures and dulled incentives, as well as threats to their funding from the Trump administration and Congress.
title: Let the colleges fail

author: Sophia Vento
description: The Trump administration on Friday dropped a lawsuit brought against Southwest Airlines by former President Biden's Transportation Department (DOT) alleging it advertised unrealistic flight schedules. The Justice Department filed a motion to dismiss the case in the U.S. District Court for Northern California after the Biden administration accused Southwest of knowingly marketing flights with impractical...
title: Trump administration drops Biden-era lawsuit against Southwest Airlines

author: Sophia Vento
description: The number of measles cases in the U.S. has risen to over 1,000 cases, according to new data from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) on Friday.  As of May 15, a total of 1,024 cases were reported across 31 states amid the deadliest outbreak in years. Per the CDC, 96 percent of...
title: US measles cases surpass 1K: CDC
